item.title: Why Do Movies Keep Repeating the Same Joke About the Afterlife?
item.description: From the recent ‘Eternity’ to classics like ‘Defending Your Life’ and ‘Beetlejuice,’ the gag remains the same: What if the next world worked just like this one?

item.title: Can You Let Your Dog Run Off-Leash Wherever You Want?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over the use of shared spaces.

item.title: The ‘Masculinity Crisis’ Is Real. This Forgotten Book Explains Why.
item.description: Why do men find it so hard to connect with other people, and their own emotions?

item.title: Shelters Won’t Let My Mother Adopt a Dog. Can I Pretend It’s for Me?
item.description: Which is the more ethical course: honoring the system’s ageist rules, or bending those rules in service of compassion?

item.title: What It’s Like When Your Wife Goes on Testosterone
item.description: She went on testosterone to help with her menopausal symptoms. The effects had unexpected consequences for their marriage.

item.title: He Was a Supreme Court Lawyer. Then His Double Life Caught Up With Him.
item.description: Thomas Goldstein was a superstar in the legal world. He was also a secret high-stakes gambler, whose wild 10-year run may now land him in prison.

item.title: My Ex-Lover Lied About His Marriage Being Over. Should I Tell His Wife?
item.description: I started feeling I wasn’t getting the full story. My instincts were correct.

item.title: The Lives They Lived
item.description: Remembering some of the artists, innovators and thinkers we lost in the past year.

item.title: Should I Feel Bad About Joining a Concierge Medical Practice?
item.description: I can afford the membership fee, but I’m torn about the ethics of being part of this growing trend.

item.title: Raja Shehadeh Believes Israelis and Palestinians Can Still Find Peace
item.description: The writer and lawyer has been documenting the occupation for decades. Somehow, he maintains hope.
